title: Ice Men's CTKCBS10 Chocolate Dark Chocolate Dial with Watch
features: Dark chocolate dial with silver-tone indexes
Silver-tone hour hands; Sweep second hand
Water resistant to 165 feet (50 M): suitable for swimming and showering
description: A fun, bright accessory that offers precise timekeeping abilities, the Ice-Watch Unisex Chocolate Collection Dark Chocolate Plastic and Silicone Watch features a circular dark chocolate dial with luminous hands, easy-to-read Arabic numeral hour indexes at three, six, nine, and 12 o'clock, and a date display at the three o'clock position. A dark chocolate-toned stainless steel bezel frames the dial and is engraved with markers from zero to 60. A durable mineral crystal window offers a handy magnifier. Made of strong silicone, the watch strap feels comfortable on for extended periods of time and is secured with a buckle. The Ice-Watch Unisex Chocolate Collection Watch is equipped with high-quality Miyota Japanese-quartz movement and is water resistant to 165 feet (50 meters).

With the launch of its first watch in November 1974, Casio entered the wristwatch market at a time when the watch industry had just discovered digital technology. As a company with cutting-edge electronic technology developed for pocket calculators, Casio entered this field confident that it could develop timepieces that would lead the market.

Today, Casio is focusing its efforts on solar-powered radio-controlled watches: the built-in solar battery eliminates the nuisance of replacing batteries, atomic timekeeping means the users never have to reset the time. Recently, Casio launched a series of Bluetooth watches that sync to the users cell phone to automatically update the time. Casio is always moving time forward.
